newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares end mixed,new shares in limelight.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares end mixed,new shares in limelight.

text.p: Recently-listed shares stole the limelight in Singapore on Tuesday, fuelled by good performances of Delifrance Asia and Labroy Marine, the two latest additions, dealers said.
"All the top actives are shares that had been listed this year," a dealer said. "They have been boosted by the good sentiment in Delifrance and Labroy."
Delifrance, which was listed on Monday, ended up Singapore $0.06 at S$1.03 on 18 million shares. Labroy Marine, listed last Friday, ended up S$0.15 at S$1.10 on 25 million shares.

SMB United firmed to S$0.32 against its IPO price of S$0.29. Advanced System Automation also ended up at S$0.95 against its IPO price of S$0.86. CM Telecom and Presscrete were also among the beneficiaries.
The Straits Times Industrials Index closed 5.39 points down at 2,038.84. Turnover improved to 154 million shares, with gainers leading losers by 206 to 102.
UOB Foreign and CityDev led the gainers, rising S$0.30 and S$0.20 respectively to S$13.20 and S$10.60.
